full_threads.body: @ricaV2 please add another 30mins to this ticket.

Hi Shane, 

We have set this up for you. James didn't specify any tracking or conversion requirements, only to add the Pinterest tag to the website... Which is what we had done. 

I have assumed that they would like to measure a conversion event of users filling out the contact form on the website (from any of the pages). 

We have now set up a conversion tag to fire when the form is submitted, and the user is redirected to the thank you page, i.e. https://trueline.net.au/thank-you/

We have tested with 2 submissions just now, and they are tracking within Pinterest as a lead. 

I hope this is what you and James were after. Let us know if anything needs to be adjusted.

Shane

Hi Shane, 

If ok with you, initially we'll just use your logins. In the event we find we're spending more time in there we will set it up correctly.

Hi Chris

would you like access as a Partner or just use my login

See below - unless you already have a business ID....

Add partners
This is recommended for brands who want to add agencies they're working with.

Before adding a partner, you'll need to ask your partner for their business ID, which is located below their business name on their Business Access page.

Log into your Pinterest business account
Click the directional chevron down icon in the top-right corner of your screen
Select Business Access from the menu
Click Partners in the left-side navigation
Click Add partner
Enter your partner's business ID
Select Invite a partner to access your assets
Click Assign ad accounts to assign permissions to the people you've added or click Maybe later if you want to do it later
Alternatively, you can add partners by clicking Ad accounts in the left-side navigation, selecting an ad account, clicking the Partners tab and clicking Assign partners.

Regards,

Shane

Sent: Thursday, 4 May 2023 11:40 AM
To: Shane Hammond <shaneh@trueline.net.au>
Subject: Pinterest Tag
Hi Shane

To set up the Pinterest Tag please see the link below:

Pinterest Tag

Once on this page please select "Get Started" and follow the prompts. You can connect directly to Google Tag Manager from within Pinterest so it might be something you can actually set up yourself.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Cheers
James
